headline.main: Attorney General Loretta Lynch Speaks Out on Orlando

snippet: The United States attorney general discussed the Orlando shooting on Sunday, saying partial transcripts will be released of the gunman's calls to authorities....
lead_paragraph: The United States attorney general discussed the Orlando shooting on Sunday, saying partial transcripts will be released of the gunman's calls to authorities.

headline.print_headline: Suicide Car Bomb Attack Kills 5 in Turkish Town; PKK Blamed
headline.main: Suicide Car Bomb Attack Kills 5 in Turkish Town; PKK Blamed

snippet: A Kurdish rebel suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle outside a police headquarters near Turkey's border with Syria Wednesday, killing five other people and wounding dozens....
lead_paragraph: A Kurdish rebel suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle outside a police headquarters near Turkey's border with Syria Wednesday, killing five other people and wounding dozens.

headline.print_headline: Bomb in Istanbul Kills 11 Near Tourist District
headline.main: Bomb in Istanbul Kills 11 Near Tourist District

snippet: Explosives in a parked car were detonated by remote control as a police shuttle bus passed through the historic Beyazit area during morning rush hour....
abstract: Car bomb detonates in Istanbul's central tourist district, destroying police vehicle and killing 11 people, including several officers; no group claims responsibility for attack, though Kurdistan Workers' Party has been responsible for several over year.
lead_paragraph: Explosives in a parked car were detonated by remote control as a police shuttle bus passed through the historic Beyazit area during morning rush hour.

snippet: Readers respond to “Waiting in Line for the Illusion of Security” (May 29)....
lead_paragraph: Readers respond to “Waiting in Line for the Illusion of Security” (May 29).

headline.print_headline: Europe; Turkey: Officials Identify Bomber as a Kurdish Rebel
headline.main: Turkey Identifies Ankara Bomber as a Kurdish Rebel

snippet: The Interior Ministry said that a woman affiliated with the Kurdistan Workers’ Party carried out the bombing in Ankara on Sunday that killed at least 37 people....
abstract: Turkey's Interior Ministry reports Seher Cagla Demir, Turkish citizen and member of militant group Kurdistan Workers' Party, was responsible for carrying out suicide car bombing in Ankara that killed at least 37 people.
lead_paragraph: The Interior Ministry said that a woman affiliated with the Kurdistan Workers’ Party carried out the bombing in Ankara on Sunday that killed at least 37 people.

headline.print_headline: Trial of Veteran Accused of Trying to Join ISIS May Hinge on Unsent Letter
headline.main: Trial of Veteran Accused of Trying to Join ISIS May Hinge on Unsent Letter

snippet: A former Air Force mechanic’s trial in Brooklyn on terrorism charges has centered on a drafted letter in which he pledged to defend the Islamic State....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Air Force veteran Tairod Pugh, accused in Federal District Court in Brooklyn of attempting to join Islamic State, is one of first Americans to stand trial on charges related to extremist group; key evidence is unsent letter addressed to his wife in which he describes plan to become martyr.
lead_paragraph: A former Air Force mechanic’s trial in Brooklyn on terrorism charges has centered on a drafted letter in which he pledged to defend the Islamic State.

headline.main: Russia Wants Syrian Kurds In Peace Talks

snippet: Russia's foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, said that moves by some members of the International Syria Support Group to exclude the Syrian Kurdish party from peace talks violates the law....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Russia's foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, said that moves by some members of the International Syria Support Group to exclude the Syrian Kurdish party from peace talks violates the law.

headline.print_headline: Taliban Attack Shows Limits of Pakistan’s Military Crackdown
headline.main: Taliban Attack Shows Limits of Pakistan’s Military Crackdown

snippet: The Taliban’s attack on a university shows that all it takes to restart the cycle of fear is a determined commander, a few willing attackers and a list of accessible targets....
abstract: News Analysis; Pakistani military's vaunted counter offensive against Taliban suffers setback with massacre at university; experts say increasingly fractious and diffuse militant group is still effective because of its ability to move across border with Afghanistan; world leaders push for peace talks between two countries to resolve problem.
lead_paragraph: The Taliban’s attack on a university shows that all it takes to restart the cycle of fear is a determined commander, a few willing attackers and a list of accessible targets.

byline.contributor: Ismail Khan contributed reporting from Peshawar, Pakistan; Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud from Islamabad, Pakistan; and Zia ur-Rehman from Karachi, Pakistan.

headline.print_headline: Teenage Rebellion, and Return to Sweden, in the Era of Terrorism
headline.main: A Swedish Girl, ISIS and a Cautionary Tale of Global Terrorism

snippet: The story of Marilyn Nevalainen stands out as a rare case in which a young European went unwittingly into the heart of jihadist territory and was freed....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Swedish teenager Marilyn Nevalainen, who unwittingly followed her jihadist boyfriend to join Islamic State in Middle East, returns to Sweden; reportedly troubled girl gave birth to son before emerging in Kurdish-controlled northern Iraq; episode reflects allure of radical Islam, often promoted by Muslim refugees, for some young Europeans.
lead_paragraph: The story of Marilyn Nevalainen stands out as a rare case in which a young European went unwittingly into the heart of jihadist territory and was freed.

byline.contributor: Tim Arango contributed reporting from Erbil, Iraq, and Christina Anderson from Mark Municipality and Gothenburg, Sweden.

headline.print_headline: Scores Killed in Iraq by ISIS Bomb Aimed at Shiite Pilgrims
headline.main: ISIS Bomb Aimed at Shiite Pilgrims in Iraq Kills at Least 80

snippet: The pilgrims, who were returning to Iran after a journey to observe Arbaeen, were killed by a truck bomb at a roadside service station....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The pilgrims, who were returning to Iran after a journey to observe Arbaeen, were killed by a truck bomb at a roadside service station.

byline.contributor: Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Erbil, an employee of The New York Times from Hilla, Iraq, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.
